flawed_nl_solution:
If Rhett is currently paid $5000 per month, he pays 1/10*$5000 = $<<1/10*5000=500>>500 in taxes.
Rhett has been late on two of his monthly rent payments and plans to pay them with 3/5*$4500=$<<3/5*4500=2070>>2070 from his salary after taxes.
If he is to pay $2070 for two late monthly rent payments, his monthly rent expense is $2070/2=$<<2070/2=1035>>1035

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2700, not 2070. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
